title: Goldman Sachs Profit Rises on Deal Bonanza; Wall Street firm's investment bankers have their second-best quarter on record
text:
Goldman deal makers continued to reap the rewards of elevated deal making activity. The firm's investment bankers brought in $3.7 billion in fees, the second-best quarter on record and 88% higher than a year ago.

The bank reported a 23% increase in trading revenue to $5.61 billion.

Goldman shares closed Thursday at $391.20. They were up about 2% in premarket trading Friday. The bank's shares are up 48% this year, hitting a record of $419.69 in August.

Write to Orla McCaffrey at orla.mccaffrey@wsj.com

Goldman Sachs Profit Rises on Deal Bonanza
